title: Understanding the Cycle of Addiction
text: Addiction is often described as a cycle with three distinct stages. Each stage represents a different aspect of the addiction process.

title: First Stage: $$\frac{Binge}{Intoxication}$$
text: The first stage involves the initial use of the substance, often characterized by bingeing or intoxication.

title: Second Stage: $$\frac{Withdrawal}{Negative}$$ Affect
text: The second stage is marked by withdrawal symptoms and negative emotional states when the substance is not used.

title: Third Stage: $$\frac{Preoccupation}{Anticipation}$$
text: The final stage involves a preoccupation with obtaining and using the substance, often leading to anticipation of the next use.
